action.action-desc: Mr. Newhouse (for himself, Mr. Jacobs of New York, Ms. Stefanik, Mr. O'Halleran, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois, Mr. McKinley, Mr. Rutherford, and Mr. Hudson) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the 21st Century Cures Act with respect to the State Opioid Response Grants program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the School Resource Officers Save Lives Act.

section.header: State Opioid Response Grants program reauthorization; pilot program for Narcan administration training

subsection.text: Section 1003(h) of the 21st Century Cures Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–3 note) is amended by striking 2021 and inserting 2023.

subsection.header: Pilot program for Narcan administration training
subsection.text: Section 1003 of the 21st Century Cures Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–3 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (j) as subsection (k); and
by inserting after subsection (i) the following:

subsection.header: Pilot program for Narcan administration training

paragraph.text: As part of the program established under this section, the Secretary shall establish a pilot program under which the Secretary will award grants to school districts—

subparagraph.text: to train school resource officers, security personnel, and school nurses in Narcan administration; and

paragraph.text: In selecting recipients of a grant under this subsection, the Secretary shall ensure that not less than 50 percent of such recipients are school districts located in a rural area (as defined by the Secretary).

As a condition on the receipt of a grant under this subsection, the school district shall agree that if the school district has a school resource officer or any security personnel, the officer (or personnel) must be trained in Narcan administration.
A school district selected to receive a grant under this subsection may use funds received through the grant—

subparagraph.text: to provide training in the administration of Narcan to school resource officers, security personnel, and school nurses; and

paragraph.text: For each of fiscal years 2022 and 2023, the Secretary shall reserve not less than $5,000,000 of the funds made available under subsection (h) to carry out the program under this subsection.
